author: {'steamid': '76561198033623422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1706895523}
review:
Much harder than the previous two games.

It seems that they have given us fewer levels but made them harder to compensate.

I finished the game in 3 hours but didn't get gold time on many of the levels. For many of them I had no real interest in replaying the level to get gold, as I couldn't really see how I could do better.

There is also no meta progression in this game unlike the last two.

There is a new mechanic that allows you to selectively generate extra resources. In my opinion the levels have become far too complex for what should be a casual game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1691676032}
review:
Rescue Team 3 is a pointless "12 Labours of Hercules" screen tapper/clicker game.  There's no gameplay, just tapping on the screen.  The game is made to look like you're making interesting decisions as you're presented with a map of a town/village/pathway that has you clicking on various things to collect things which are then consumed when you click on an obstacle, which unlocks more things to click on.  This is so lame and shallow, you could write a script to randomly click the screen and given enough time, it would beat the game.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no option to change the resolution and no useful graphics tweaks.  There's no way to ensure this is running at the native resolution of your display.  There's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.

The game features simple, cartoony 2D graphics, of the type you normally expect to see in low effort mobile apps.  3D graphics programming does require a degree of skill and competence and unfortunately not all developers have the budget or talent to deliver this, despite 3D graphics cards hitting the mainstream in the 1990's.  Considering this is being evaluated as a PC game, having the graphics phoned in like this isn't going to result in a high quality, visually impressive game that PC gamers are used to seeing.

The game only displays in 4:3 pillarboxed aspect ratio.  It's possible they developed this using an old CRT they found in a dumpster, or this game has been specifically designed for people gaming on PC's from 1995... either way, this isn't really acceptable in the modern era of PC gaming.

The controls can't be customised because the game has such a dumbed down, simplified interface that it's just iPhone screen tapping stuff.  The fact that the interface is this dumbed down might be seen as a problem in itself, however... this is a fairly shallow experience if you're the kind of gamer that likes to play games with deep, rich control schemes and interaction.  You'll get none of that here.

This looks and feels like a mobile app, but it doesn't seem to have made it to the app stores.  It's unclear why this was put on Steam instead of the app stores it seems to have been designed for.  Maybe it was removed, maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes Rescue Team 3 might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.  We don't spend all this money building gaming rigs so we can pretend they're iPhones and play games that might as well be mobile apps.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Rescue Team 3 has the ridiculous, laughable price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375111316', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1681754378}
review:
É o terceiro jogo da franquia, e ele começa alterando a gameplay que você tem no primeiro e segundo jogo, novos recursos são introduzidos no lugar.
Você acaba sem um objetivo principal como o de reconstruir os locais destruídos pela tempestade, o que para mim era algo muito divertido.
No geral é um jogo que não passa a mesma essência dos 2 primeiros, e pra mim que adora aquele estilo, esse foi um jogo que eu não pretendo voltar a jogar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1686316287}
review:
[h1] Rescue Team 3 [/h1]
Collection game from 2013.

Save the day as the leader of the Rescue Team, a group of lifesaving professionals trained to step in and clean up after a natural disaster!
(Abridged by developer)

A good game with a good story. This is peppered with biting irony. Unfortunately, this is a very real reckoning with corruption and abuse of power. Really very well implemented and all packed into a collecting game.
The gameplay is good too. The cards are easy. Perfect for those who don't know such games yet.

You have to collect and build. Removing obstacles is your main task. Everything made clear and easy to do.
Having played all the games in this series and quite a few more, I can tell you that this one is really, really good.
Clear recommendation, for really everyone.

My group and my archive with over 5,500 reviews here: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

[h1] Rescue Team 3 [/h1]
Sammelspiel von 2013.

Retten Sie den Tag als Anführer des Rettungsteams, einer Gruppe lebensrettender Profis, die darauf trainiert sind, nach einer Naturkatastrophe einzuspringen und aufzuräumen!
(Gekürzt vom Entwickler)

Ein gutes Spiel mit einer guten Geschichte. Diese ist gespickt mit beißender Ironie. Eine leider sehr reale Abrechnung mit Korruption und Macht Missbrauch. Wirklich sehr gut umgesetzt und dies alles verpackt in ein Sammelspiel. 
Auch das Gameplay ist gut. Die Karten sind leicht. Perfekt für alle die solche Spiele bisher nicht kennen.  

Du musst Sammeln und Bauen. Hindernisse beseitigen ist deine Hauptaufgabe. Alles übersichtlich gemacht und ohne Schwierigkeiten zu bewerkstelligen. 
Da ich alle Spiele dieser Serie gespielt habe und noch etliche mehr, kann ich euch berichten das dieses hier wirklich echt gut ist.
Deutliche Empfehlung, für wirklich jeden.

Meine Gruppe und mein Archiv mit über 5.500 Reviews hier: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

author: {'steamid': '76561198248280064', 'num_games_owned': 2913, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1617227450}
review: Rescue Team 3 est un jeu de gestion de temps et de craft, où nous retrouvons notre équipe de choc, toujours à braver les dangers, pour sauver la population, de catastrophes naturelles. Très bon jeu, avec une grosse évolution graphique et visuelle, par rapport aux deux premiers opus et quelques ajouts de gameplay bien sympathique. Dommage par contre, que l'argent que l'on gagne, ne sert plus à rien. Dans les précédents jeux, elle permettait de réparer une maison (dans le premier) et une ville (dans le second). Et selon si on gagnait la médaille d'or, d'argent ou de bronze, on gagnait plus ou moins. Là il y a toujours cette règle de gagner plus ou moins, selon la médaille, mais rien à rénover. L'option a disparue, c'est dommage!

author: {'steamid': '76561198169309012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1680391104}
review: es ist verschieden

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135223', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1586871534}
review:
3ème opus de la série Rescue TEam.
Il ne change pas les codes précédemment établis par la série, c'est toujours un jeu de gestion du temps. Il y a eut quelques ajouts, dont le plus important est que vous pouvez demander aux personnes sauvées de travailler pour vous, ce qui augmente les revenu des bâtiments ou ils se trouvent.
Cet ajout au gameplay est lié à une apparition de scénario. Jusqu'a présent dans la série, il y avait des catastrophes dans une ville et la Rescue Team apparaissait pour sauver les personnes et rebâtir ce qui avait été détruit. Mais là on en apprends bien plus sur cette équipe, et ce n'est pas une ONG désintéressée, ce sont de véritables mercenaires professionnels qui sont là pour intervenir là où les autres refusent de le faire.
Ils sont très cher, et ne posent pas de question, ce qui tombe bien car c'est la ville d'un maire véreux qui a été touchée par des catastrophes.
Cela a l'air d'être anecdotique, mais je trouve ça très bien pensé, cela donne une autre vision du jeu, et c'est très agréable.
Je finirai sur la difficulté qui est bien dosée, il y a de plus des succès à réaliser durant les missions! Vraiment ce jeu est complet.
Je recommande Rescue Team 3 pour son gameplay et pour son coté cynique!

review: Rescue Team 3 is an enjoyable time/resource management game and the third game of the series. You collect resources, repair buildings and roads, and remove debris. You also rescue the residents. It's a fun game and you should get it if you are a fan of the genre.

review:
这游戏商店页面有两处地方显示有误.

商店页面显示有中文,其实游戏内是没有的.
商店页面显示没有游戏卡牌,其实是有的.

review: Lo compre a un precio infimo en las rebajas de verano porque estos juegos de gestión de tiempo me gustan, pero desgraciadamente  no puedo decir que lo este disfrutando, es un juego mediocre que no es balanceado,  genera excesivos trabajadores  que  no son útiles para la gestion de tiempo,  picos de dificultad que muchas veces no son lógicos, por otra parte me ha generado tal tedio que en ciertos niveles donde no he alcanzado el oro no me provoca  repetir.  Le diria a las personas que no compren esta saga, es una copia mal hecha de la saga de Hercules.

review:
[h1]Simplistic and entertaining enough to pass the time.[/h1]

This third installment adds a bit to the graphics and a few new things to do compared to previous in the series, so that was nice.  Overall, the game is a casual play through that is only really challenging if you want to get a Gold rating on the levels, which I didn't want to, so I just relaxed and enjoyed my time! Campaign took me roughly 3.75 hrs.

Not very polished but wasn't expecting it to be. 7 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198068110547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1529586091}
review:
I don't care for a lot of the changes made in the third installment, and ultimately didn't enjoy playing it nearly as much as the previous two. 
 
Pros-
-Firemen & Policemen are a nice addition
-Treating animals was a nice change of pace
-The fire spreading through wood debris that endangers civilians adds to the excitement

Cons-
-Villagers needing to be assigned over and over again to the same buildings are tedious 
-Removal of the player house, & its upgrades
-All the cutscenes actually took away from my enjoyment of the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198137160874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1498438463}
review:
I picked up this game in a bundle with the first two titles in the series, and it was well worth it. If you've played the earlier two games, you'll appreciate the improvements made in this version.

The traditional obstacles and pickups are there, but now there's a queue for when you have multiple objects to collect at once. The result is that you're no longer frantically clicking to make sure your worker runs out as soon as they're available. Instead, a little "check mark" appears next to items in your queue (which you can remove with a right-click) and keep your workers moving, leaving more of the game to your strategy as opposed to the speed of your clicking finger. They've introduced oil/petrol as a collected resource, so now helicopters and boats have their own required resource and allow for the inclusion of fuel stations and oil wells.

Other enhancements and improvements in level design await you. Workers, doctors, helicopters, firefighters, and police all need to be deployed to solve the varied puzzles. Obstacles include piles of wood and rock, forest fires (which, on later levels, can spread and cause you to fail the stage if you're not quick enough to respond!), burglars, and even poison gases.

A snarky story ties things all together (impressive enough to include dialogue between characters!), and even hints at a sequel. The art has received an overhaul as well, so as you progress through the game you'll be greeted by varied stages, character renderings, and decent 2D special effects.

To sum up, this is a fitting entry to the series, and much improved from the previous titles. If you're already a fan of this series or time-management games in general, you'll be pleased.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1483011101}
review:
[h1]Short version: 82%[/h1]
Rescue Team 3’s revitalised formula—including faster, tighter gameplay and especially its sarcastic storyline—elevates it far above many similar time management games.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Rescue Team 3 is a sequel that changes things around, and changes them a fair bit.
On the surface, it may not be apparent, as gameplay-wise it is the same time manager game as the rest of the series. We use a bunch of rescue workers to collect resources, clear obstacles, patch up ruined buildings, and save civilians. Thanks to one nice trick though, it is also a lot faster than its predecessors were: workers stay on the field a bit after completing a task, which cuts downtime significantly, resulting in a tighter, more fun gameplay. (Also, we can finally use the civilians for one-time production bursts.)

The real strength of Rescue Team 3 lies in its storyline. Many may not like its approach, but it is a refreshing change compared to the sanitised cuteness of most casual games.
In this game, we have to rescue the citizens of one of the most corrupt government in existence, who wilfully neglected all safety precautions to embezzle even more money. Now, they use some of that money to pay off a bunch of amoral, lazy rescue workers who spend almost as much effort looking for ways to fill their own pockets as doing their job. Yes, this game is full of cynicism and sarcasm, but in an incredibly humorous, nonsensical way, and this change alone makes it probably the best in the entire series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332887878', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1504531764}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1494279375}
review:
"Rescue Team 3" ist ein kleines und simples Time-Management Spiel.

In 41 Leveln (leider neun weniger als im Vorgänger und neunzehn weniger als im Vorvorgänger) und damit auch auf 41 Karten schicken wir unser Team auf Straßen zu ständig wechselnden Aufträgen. Meist schicken wir zu Beginn zwei Arbeiter los, räumen Baumstämme von der Straße, was Nahrung verbraucht und Holz bringt. Dann reparieren wir ein Gebäude mit dem Holz, das wiederum produziert dann in rhythmischen Abständen Nahrung oder Holz oder Gold. Es gilt Geröll wegzuräumen, Straßen zu reparieren, Brücken wiederherzustellen, Häfen oder Hubschrauberlandeplätze in Schuß zu bringen. Mit dem dann vorhandenen Schiff können wir (je nach Karte) Holz aus dem Wasser fischen, oder Fische aus dem Wasser fischen oder Überlebende aus dem Wasser retten (was alles Gold kostet). Der Hubschrauber kann Feuer löschen oder Überlebende retten wofür Benzin benötigt wird, das in Tankstellen produziert wird. 

Anders als in den Vorgängern können wir Gebäude auch upgraden und Gerettete in ihnen arbeiten lassen. Oder Gebäude können durch Diebe lahmgelegt werden, die dann mit Polizisten vertrieben werden müssen, was Gold kostet. Im Wesentlichen bleibt aber alles beim alten. 

Um eine Karte zu gewinnen müssen wir etwa alle Überlebenden retten oder auch alle Edelsteine aufsammeln. Schaffen wir das Ganze möglichst rasch (je nach Karte etwa 2-5 Minuten) erhalten wir Silber- oder Goldpokale. Letzere sind mit etwas Planung und Übersicht zu schaffen, Silber kriegt man eigentlich fast immer, auch ohne sich besonders anzustrengen.

Schwierig ist das Spielchen also nicht. Die Umsetzung ist sauber, alles funktioniert und  die Level sind im Großen und Ganzen ganz nett gebaut. Wie bei allen diesen Spielchen kann man diesem auch einen gewissen Suchtfaktor nicht absprechen. 

Grafisch wirkt Alles simpel aber knuddelig, ebenso verhält es sich mit Musik und Soundeffekten.

Dennoch ist der dritte Teil - nicht nur wegen dem geringeren Umfang - der schwächste Teil. Vieles wirkt uninspiriert, die Spielzeit ist gering und kleine Nettigkeiten der Vorgänger wie, daß man durch Punkte auf einem gesonderten Screen rein optische Upgrades machen konnte (ein Haus wieder reparieren) fehlen hier vollständig.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
6/10 Atmosphäre
4/10 Story
5/10 Grafik
5/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
6/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Etwas liebloser Abklatsch der Vorgänger.

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198066382847', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1483689803}

author: {'steamid': '76561198364388439', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1491314722}
review:
Teil 3 der Zeitmanagement-Spieleserie ist super gelungen.
Die Levels sind sehr schön gezeichnet und abwechslungsreich gestaltet, leider wieder einmal kein HD Modus.
Mir gefällt es noch viel besser als Teil 2, denn hier bekommt man erstmals sehr differenzierte und andere Aufgaben als immer nur die 2-3 Standardaufgaben, die man in Teil 2 erledigen muste.
Am liebsten hätte ich dieses Spiel in einem Rutsch durchgezockt, so toll ist es.
Erstmals kann man in diesem Teil der Serie die geretteten Menschen in Gebäude schicken. 
Das bringt 20 Extraressourcen. Dadurch wird das Spiel noch um einiges taktischer.
Auch, weil man nun endlich die Gebäude mehrmals aufwerten kann.
Man steht also ständig vor der Entscheidung, welches seiner Gebäude man zuerst aufwerten möchte, oder ob man als nächstes einen Menschen oder einen Bauarbeiter retten möchte. 
Das man einfach richtig viel Spaß.
Die Story und die schönen Karten tun ihr übriges dazu.
Das Spiel ist übrigens gerade im Deal.
Für das Geld eine absolute Kaufempfehlung!

Sound/Grafik: 7/10
Spielspaß: 9/10
Gesamtwertung: 8/10

Preis-Leistung: 10/10
The first in the Rescue Team series that tries something new. The graphics have received an overhaul over the previous two titles, the game features a story which can be amusing, but I skipped over it most of the time as I found it a distraction, and the map design has been changed from a pathing system to something more open.

Overall, initially the changes were unwelcome after playing the first two games, but once I got used to the more open world and started clicking through the story, the game still has the major time and resource elements to keep you hooked and trying for those gold results.

Казуал есть казуал. Кому-то играть в такие игры интересно, а кому-то нет. Это хорошее времяпрепровождение, если выдалось какое-то время посидеть за компьютером, а запускать более серьёзные игрушки не хочется. 

Что касается языковой поддержки в игре. Игра переведена на три языка: английский, немецкий и русский. Возможно, есть поддержка и других языков (где-то), но то, что устанавливается из Стима содержит только 3 языка. По умолчанию, игра запускается на английском языке. Возможности изменить язык в настройках нет. Что само по себе странно ибо реализовать не сложно. Если хочется по играть читая текст на русском (или немецком), то нужно сделать следующее:
ПКМ на игре в библиотеке -> "Свойства" -> "Локальные файлы" -> "Просмотр локальных файлов" (откроется расположение игры на компе) -> пройти в папку "\data\conf" -> открыть в блокноте файл "autoexec.lua" -> заменить в строке "en" на "ru" для русского (или "de" для немецкого) -> закрыть файл с сохранением -> играть...
Все изменения на ваш страх и риск.


В свойствах игры можно изменять язык, но русский там не поставить. При этом, если выбрать любой, отличный от Английского, то удалится и локализация на русский язык.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083604406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1489428048}
review:
Trzecia część ratowania świata po zniszczeniach. Różne zadania związane z odbudową zniszczeń. Im dalej tym rodzaj dostępnych pracowników się zwiększa (oraz surowców potrzebnych do zebrania). 
Niestety w stosunku do poprzednich dwóch części tym razem wydawca pojechał wg mnie „po bandzie”.
Zamiast 60 plansz mamy 40. Zadania zostały bardziej „skomplikowane” i w celu zdobycia „złotego” czasu musimy korzystać ze znajdek / przyspieszaczy. Niestety by „budowlaniec” je podniósł trzeba dokładnie trafić, do tego mimo „trafienia” za pierwszym razem nie załapuje co prowadzi do irytacji gdy takich premii musimy złapać ze 3 dla różnych ludków. 
Co najważniejsze – mimo że pisze – gra nie jest po Polsku !
Osobiście uważam, że dwie poprzednie części lepsze. Jednak jeśli traficie gierkę w promocji to oczywiście kupować.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1483984540}
review:
The first in the Rescue Team series that tries something new. The graphics have received an overhaul over the previous two titles, the game features a story which can be amusing, but I skipped over it most of the time as I found it a distraction, and the map design has been changed from a pathing system to something more open.

Overall, initially the changes were unwelcome after playing the first two games, but once I got used to the more open world and started clicking through the story, the game still has the major time and resource elements to keep you hooked and trying for those gold results.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993139288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1451927019}
review: Questo gioco è più sulla rapidità che sulla tattica. Però mi ha divertito e l’ho finito. Dovrete gestire una squadra di soccorritori per salvare persone da incendi ed altre catastrofi. I livelli hanno più o meno le stesse cose solo che diventano più complessi. Si vede proprio che nasce per dispositivi mobili, non amo il genere, però questo non è male. Da comprare in saldo a pochi euro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044653396', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1574087529}
review:
6/10

This is not a 'micro manage your community' style game, although it looks like one at first.

I wanted to enjoy this game because I love micro managing little communities, upgrading structures, collecting supplies and all that typical stuff you expect from a game like this. But it is way too simple and there aren't any real options that seem to change the gameplay by any noteworthy amount. Really, the only thing that might be different on a second play through is how fast I complete each level, or meeting the criteria for an achievement. Otherwise, there is no structure placement, only stuctures that already exist which need repairs to function.

Its just too basic for me and everything is the game is predetermined. But if you like to get a game so that you can complete it with all achievements, then it might pose a challenge in that area.  

You collect gold, wood, and food mostly because your characters need the supplies to do things. You click food supllies so you have the points to assign a character to collect wood, click a broken building when you have wood to repair it, click gold bars so you can assign someone to remove rocks, click wood again so you can assign someone to repair the fire station, click fire so the new fire station can send a guy to put the fire out, click food again, click gold bar, click wood, click building, level over.

On a positive note: The music aint horrible, the graphics are fair, and the interface is better than some.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141582705', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1637495486}
